actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Patents, Copyrights and Trademarks.
Committee on Judiciary requested executive comment from Patent and Trademark Office (Commerce Department).
Committee on Judiciary received executive comment from Patent and Trademark Office (Commerce Department).

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Patents, Copyrights and Trademarks

official_title: A bill to protect the name and marks of the Alabama Space Science Exhibit Commission.
short_title: Alabama Space Science Exhibit Commission Act

summary.text: Alabama Space Science Exhibit Commission Act - Grants the Alabama Space Science Exhibit Commission the exclusive right to use the names and marks: (1) "The Space Rocket Center"; (2) "Space Camp"; (3) "Space Academy"; and (4) "United States Space Camp." Provides that such names and marks shall be considered trademarks or trade names for purposes of the Trademark Act of 1946.

titles.title: Alabama Space Science Exhibit Commission Act
A bill to protect the name and marks of the Alabama Space Science Exhibit Commission.
